turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Epididymitis.
turn.1: What is the role of diagnostics in Epididymitis?
turn.2: A scrotal ultrasound may reveal problems with the epididymis, but such an ultrasound may also show nothing unusual.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The majority of patients who present with chronic epididymitis have had symptoms for over five years.
turn.5: What are the complications of the disease?
turn.6: Untreated, acute epididymitis's major complications are abscess formation and testicular infarction.
turn.7: Can the disease spread to other organs?
turn.8: Chronic epididymitis can lead to permanent damage or even destruction of the epididymis and testicle (resulting in infertility and/or hypogonadism), and infection may spread to any other organ or system of the body.
turn.9: Is there any other complication of the disease?
turn.10: Chronic pain is also an associated complication for untreated chronic epididymitis.
turn.11: What is the most common cause of the disease?
turn.12: Though urinary tract infections in men are rare, bacterial infection is the most common cause of acute epididymitis.
